intro: Crucifera altissima, commonly known as the tall mustard, is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its distinctive four-petaled flowers. This plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in a variety of habitats including fields, roadsides, and waste areas. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. The leaves are usually alternate and have a slightly serrated edge, while the stems are often hairy. Due to its rapid growth and adaptability, it is considered a common weed in many regions.
